feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: DI API Connect using a Windows Service
entry.content:
I’m trying to make an SAP Business One (DI API) connection in a loop, iterating through several companies (CompanyDB) to connect to each one individually. Even though the user credentials and database names are correct, some databases return an error during the connection.

The company.Connect() method returns a non-zero value, and GetLastError returns the message: "-146 Tenant is no exist".

The credentials are correct (we can log in to SAP normally), the CompanyDB name is correct, and the server type (dbServerType) is being set appropriately (HANA or SQL Server).

However, the error still appears. What could be causing this?

entry.title: B1SiteUser is Disabled – Unable to enable it
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m facing an issue with B1SiteUser being disabled on SAP Business One SQL version SP 2408.

I’ve tried the following methods:

Adding a user for logging into the Authentication Service (Keycloak):

I set up the user in the system variables, but it didn’t work in Keycloak.

Resetting B1SiteUser using the SAP Business One reconfiguration wizard:

The wizard runs, but at the final step I get the error:
“System Landscape Directory contains no compatible database instances.”

I’m not sure how to proceed to enable or reset B1SiteUser properly.

Has anyone encountered this issue before or can guide me on how to resolve it?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Export Crystal Report Design Preview to PDF
entry.content:
Hi All

How is it possible to always Default Save As Type to PDF instead of Crystal Report .rpt when Export Crystal Report Design Preview?

 

 

Kedalene Chong

entry.title: Error 7000 while installing Integration services (B1if)
entry.content:
The installation is running from Setup.exe, and the installation files are stored locally on the server.

I installed the SAP Business One Client to test the connection – it works correctly.

The Integration Services installation runs to completion, but an error appears at the very end.

 StpWiz       Err            I Tec Application execution failed with error 7000 
 StpWiz       Err            I Tec " Install finished with error 7000

entry.title: How to increase the number of valid values of a combo box from default 100
entry.content:
Hello,
 
I am doing a SAP B1 web client extensibility project using UI API extensions (VSCode) in which on a UDO form , I am adding a custom grid.One of the column in the custom grid is of type combo box.
I am filling this combobox using a field from another UDO. The problem I am facing is that even if the service layer response gets back around 316 records from that UDO,
The combobox only shows 100 records listed.So I am not able to select other values.
 
How can I increase the number of valid values in that combo box.My combo filling code is given below. Also the layout file setting of the combocontrol is given. Can anybody help?
I tried setSizeLimit() for the datamodel,It is not allowed in web client UI API.
 
************* Combo filling code*********************************
 
 async POLineFill(oEnv) {
      try {
        console.log("POLineFill started");
        const oView = await oEnv.ActiveView();
        
        await oView.setCustomizedData(null, "data3");
 
        const service = await oEnv.getService();
        let response = await service.ServiceLayer.get("TWBS_CM_CONT?$select=U_POLine");
        
        if(!response.isSuccess()){
          console.log("Service call failed in POLineFill");
          return;
        }
 
        let podata = response.getData();
        let allItems = new Map();
        console.log(`Fetched ${podata.value.length} POLines from first page`);
 
        // Add empty option
        allItems.set("", { key: "", text: "", id: "empty-option" });
 
        // Process initial data
        podata.value.forEach((item, index) => {
          if (item.U_POLine) {
            allItems.set(item.U_POLine, {
              key: item.U_POLine,
              text: item.U_POLine,
              id: `poline-${index}`
            });
          }
        });
 
        // Handle pagination
        let nextUrl = podata['@odata.nextLink'];
        let pageIndex = 1;
        console.log("Next url  for pagination:", nextUrl);
 
        while (nextUrl) {
          let nextResponse = await service.ServiceLayer.get(nextUrl);
          if (!nextResponse.isSuccess()) break;
          
          let nextData = nextResponse.getData();
          
          nextData.value.forEach((item, index) => {
            if (item.U_POLine && !allItems.has(item.U_POLine)) {
              allItems.set(item.U_POLine, {
                key: item.U_POLine,
                text: item.U_POLine,
                id: `poline-${pageIndex}-${index}`
              });
            }
          });
          console.log(`Fetched ${nextData.value.length} POLines from page ${pageIndex + 1}`);
          nextUrl = nextData['@odata.nextLink'];
          pageIndex++;
        }
 
        // Convert to array
        const comboBoxData = Array.from(allItems.values()).sort();
 
        console.log(`Total unique POLines loaded: ${comboBoxData.length}`);
 
        await oView.setCustomizedData({ comboBoxData }, "data3");
        
        
        console.log("POLineFill completed");
        
      } catch(error) {
        console.error("Error in POLineFill:", error);
      }
    }
 
************   layout file***********************************
 
                                             "columns": [
 
{
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Column",
"guid": "k12qZkmVovquw6fXLmRxqz",
"text": "Choose PO Line",
"template": {
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.ComboBox",
"guid": "dcmfTcU59HCwny9WxkWMZy",
"editable": true,
"enabled": true,
"showSecondaryValues": true,
"filterSecondaryValues": true,
 
 
"items": {
"path": "@@data3>/comboBoxData",
"length": "{@@data3>/comboBoxData/length}",
"template": {
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Item",
"key": "{@@data3>key}",
"text": "{@@data3>text}"
}
},
"change": {
"procName": "onPOComboChange"
  }
}
}
 
 
 
 
 
Thanks,
 
Deepesh

entry.title: Browser Access not working from user system (same network) — SAP Business One
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I need some help configuring SAP Business One Browser Access.

I have successfully installed the Browser Access on the server and can access it locally using the following URL:

 
https://<ServerName>:<Port>/dispatcher

It opens and works fine when accessed from the server system.

However, when I try to access the same URL from a user system (which is under the same network), it does not open.

Here’s what I’ve done so far:

  • Browser Access Service installed and running on the server.

  • Tried using both the server name and IP address in the URL.

  • All users are on the same network.

    Could someone guide me if I missed any configuration steps?
    Do I need to make any changes in the firewall settings, SSL certificate, or hosts file for user systems to connect successfully?

    Any insights or troubleshooting steps would be appreciated.

    Thanks in advance!

     SAP Business One, version for SAP HANA SAP Business One  SAP Business One Extensibility

entry.title: How can small job portals or recruitment websites integrate SAP tools for better data management?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I run a small-scale project related to job listings and exam notifications (for example, websites like rojgar--result.com).
Such portals usually handle a large amount of user data, including job applications, result updates, and notifications.

I wanted to ask:
 

  •   Can SAP tools like SAP Business One or SAP HANA Cloud be used to manage and automate such data workflows?
  •   What would be the best way to integrate SAP with a website built on WordPress or PHP for analytics and structured data management?

It would be great to know if anyone has implemented similar solutions or has recommendations on where to start.

entry.title: Why Choose SAP Business One Over Traditional ERP for SMEs?
entry.content:
Why Choose SAP Business One Over Traditional ERP for SMEs?

Article Teaser:
Small and mid-sized businesses often struggle with large ERP systems built for big corporations. SAP Business One offers a leaner, smarter alternative designed specifically for SMEs. But what makes it stand out? Let’s explore the differences and why it often wins.

A Simple View: Traditional ERP vs SAP Business One

Traditional ERPs are powerful but they come with high cost, long setup time, and heavy processes. For many SMEs, this means delays and overhead.

SAP Business One is built for smaller operations. It connects finance, sales, inventory and operations in one system. It supports on-premise or cloud deployment. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

Key Advantages for SMEs

  • Speed and Cost-Efficiency: SAP Business One uses fewer resources to deploy and maintain. SMEs can start faster and without heavy budgets. 
  • Built-In Modules for Core Functions: Finance, CRM, inventory, production and reporting all in one system. This reduces silos and errors.
  • Real-Time Insights and Reporting: Leaders make decisions quickly based on live data, not just past reports. 
  • Scalability and Flexibility: Though built for SMEs, the system grows with you adding users or modules as needed. 

When Traditional ERP Still Makes Sense

If your business is very large, highly global, or has ultra-complex processes, a full enterprise ERP might still be the right choice. But for most SMEs needing speed, clarity and cost control, SAP Business One hits the balance.

Practical Example

Imagine an SME with multiple warehouses, global sales, and service calls. With SAP Business One you get:

  • Visible inventory across locations.
  • Sales orders are linked directly to stock and deliveries.
  • Finance sees profit by product, region, or season in a few clicks.
  • Compliance and audits are easier because data is in one system.

Instead of juggling spreadsheets and multiple tools, everything lives in one system made for your size.

Conclusion

For SMEs seeking a business system that delivers strength without the overhead of full enterprise ERP, SAP Business One offers a compelling option. It connects core functions, gives live data to decision-makers, scales with growth, and keeps costs in check.

entry.title: Inconsistent Foreign Key naming in Service Contract (OOAT - OAT1) tables
entry.content: hi experts, I have a question regarding the table structure of the Blanket Agreement (Contract) in SAP Business One. I've observed an inconsistency in the foreign key naming between the header and detail tables, which is different from other business documents in the system. The header table [OOAT] uses AbsId (Integer) as its Primary Key. The detail table [OAT1] uses AgrNo (Integer) as the Foreign Key, which points to [@OAGR].AbsId. In all other major documents (e.g., Sales Order ORDR/RDR1, Invoice OINV/INV1), the header and detail tables use the same field name ( DocEntry) for the primary and foreign key relationship. My Question: What is the historical or design reason behind this naming inconsistency specifically for the Blanket Agreement tables? Why is the foreign key in [OAT1] named AgrNo instead of AbsId to match the header table? This seems to be a unique case, as other master data like Business Partner (OCRD) and Items (OITM) also use consistent names (CardCode, ItemCode) between their header and child tables. I have verified the relationship with an SQL query, which confirms the join is ON [OOAT].AbsId = [OAT1].AgrNo. Any insights into this design decision would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP B1 Landed cost is showing correct in Inventory Audit report but total value showing wrong
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We've encountered an issue in SAP Business One related to the Inventory Audit Report. The landed cost values for items are displaying correctly, but the total value in the report appears to be incorrect or inconsistent.

entry.title: Argentina - Is POI Mandatory for Purchasing Documents?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m wondering whether the header-level field POI (PTICode) is truly mandatory for purchasing documents in the SAP Business One – Argentina localisation, or if this is a matter of configuration. So far, we haven’t been able to post any documents without it.

Since we post documents via integration, our tests are failing due to the absence of this reference, and adding a dummy value to the payload is currently not an option.

We understand the requirement for sales documents, as POI is necessary for electronic invoicing. However, SAP’s documentation isn’t clear on whether the same applies to purchasing documents.

Any insights would be greatly appreciated!

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: Link between SAP B1 Picklist and its target document such as Delivery, A/R Invoice
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you pls share some insights on how to get the Link between SAP B1 Picklist and its target document such as Delivery, A/R Invoice?

While Checking the Delivery, A/R Invoice child such as DLNxx & INVxx, We couldn't figure out any references, likewise PKLxx also doesn't seems to store the information.

 

Best Regards

Anand Ramachandran

entry.title: Landed Cost Revision With Multiple Vendor
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I add a landed cost document with multiple vendors. It has doc number 11.

When i try to revision this document, i can't.

If i use one vendor on landed cost i follow Copy From -> Landed Cost, but i try this with multiple vendor can't find number 11 document.

List show me wrong documents.

I attachment screen shot. This step show me Vendors tab which choose it list me this landed cost but not list me number 11.

How can i choose and revision number 11?

SAP B1 Version: 10

SP: 2505

Thank you.

entry.title: Severe Server Slowness and Freezing on SAP B1 (Version 10.0 FP 2208)
entry.content:
We are experiencing severe system slowness and freezing on our SAP Business One environment. The issue has significantly affected normal operations — users are unable to process transactions or navigate efficiently within SAP.

System Environment:

  • Server OS: Windows Server 2019 Datacenter

  • Processor: Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 5218 CPU @ 2.30GHz (14 virtual processors)

  • Installed Memory (RAM): 98 GB

  • SAP Version: SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2208

  • Database: [Specify — e.g., SQL Server 2019 / SAP HANA]

  • Uptime: ~4 hours before performance degradation (based on Task Manager data)

Performance Observations (from Task Manager):

  • CPU Utilization: ~52%

  • Memory Usage: 96% (93.9 GB / 98 GB)

  • Disk Usage: Moderate activity (5–17 KB/s)

  • Processes Running: 222

Impact:

  • SAP clients intermittently freeze or take long to respond

  • Posting and report generation are delayed

  • Multiple users affected

entry.title: Question about DI Server License Compatibility with SAP Business One 10.0
entry.content:
I have a question regarding the SAP Business One DI Server license currently used for data interface from a 3rd-party system in SAP B1 (SQL Server) version 9.2.

We are planning to upgrade to SAP Business One version 10.0, and I would like to confirm whether the existing DI Server license can still be used in version 10.0.

From my understanding, the interface data in version 10.0 is recommended to use the Indirect Access license instead.
If that’s the case, could you please advise how to upgrade or convert the DI Server license to an Indirect Access (per-user) license?

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: SAP Business One Mobile App Configuration & Certificate Hosting Behind Firewall
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I would really appreciate your guidance on this.

I recently implemented SAP Business One for one of my customers, and they have requested access to the SAP B1 Mobile App. I started the configuration by installing B1if, and the database connection was successfully tested — everything worked fine until I reached the step in the SAP documentation that mentions certificate installation.

Here’s where I’m stuck:
The IT department has informed me that due to their firewall and security policies, they do not want to expose the SAP server to the public internet. They asked me to come back with a secure hosting approach or alternative method that would allow mobile access without breaching security guidelines.

Can anyone please guide me on:

  1. What exactly are the certificates required at this stage?

  2. How can I host the mobile app service URL securely behind a firewall?

Your insights or real-time examples would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your time and support!

Best regards,

entry.title: SAP B1 Email Alert Configuration
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I’m currently working on activating Email Alerts in SAP Business One, and I need your help to clarify a few points.

SMTP Connection Issue
When I tried to configure my personal email’s SMTP settings(FOr Testing Purpose) in the Job Service Portal, I got this error message:

“Cannot connect to the SMTP server.”

Could someone guide me on what might cause this error?
What are the prerequisites or checks (like firewall rules, ports, or certificate settings) I should perform before configuring email alerts in SAP B1?

Email Configuration Locations
I noticed that email configuration options are available in both:

  • Job Service Portal, and

  • General Settings (Administration → System Initialization → General Settings → Services tab)

My question is:
Should the email configuration for alerts be done in Job Service Portal or in General Settings?
Why does SAP provide two different configuration areas for email setup?

Any step-by-step explanation or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: DI API: Price Assignment Invalid After Changing Rdr1 ItemCode
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I have recently been updating Ordr and the line item Rdr1 via the DI API. I noticed that when I change the ItemCode from the original line to another ItemCode, the Price becomes 0. Clearly, I have assigned a different value to it, but this issue results in both the order amount and line amount not being the values I intended. This is quite strange, and I would like to know why this is happening and if there is a solution.
Below is the code I'm using

  //Update
  foreach (LineDetail rdr1 in addedDetails)
  {
      int tl = _initLines.IndexOf((int)rdr1.LineNum);
      if (tl >= 0)
      {
          dts.Lines.SetCurrentLine(tl);
          if (dts.Lines.LineStatus == BoStatus.bost_Open)
          {
              dts.Lines.ItemCode = rdr1.ItemCode.Replace("\", "■");
              dts.Lines.ItemDescription = rdr1.Dscription;
              dts.Lines.Quantity = System.Convert.ToDouble(rdr1.Quantity);
              dts.Lines.WarehouseCode = rdr1.WhsCode == "" ? "01" : rdr1.WhsCode;
              dts.Lines.UnitPrice = dts.Lines.Price = Convert.ToDouble(rdr1.PriceBefDi);                          dts.Lines.DiscountPercent = Convert.ToDouble(rdr1.DiscPrcnt);
              dts.Lines.LineTotal = Convert.ToDouble(rdr1.LineTotal);
              dts.Lines.Currency = model.DocCur;
          }
         
      }
      // ...
      var res = dts.Update();
  }
